cluster_name.description: A unique identifier for the head node and workers of this cluster.

workspace_name.description: The workspace resource for this cluster.

from.description: Inherit configurations from another configuration in templates folder.

min_workers.description: The minimum number of worker nodes to launch. Use the per node_type min_workers field instead.

max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers nodes to launch in addition to the head node. This takes precedence over min_workers.

upscaling_speed.description: The scaler will scale up the cluster faster with higher upscaling speed. E.g., if the task requires adding more nodes then scaler will gradually scale up the cluster in chunks of upscaling_speed*currently_running_nodes. This number should be > 0.

idle_timeout_minutes.description: If a node is idle for this many minutes, it will be removed.

bootstrapped.description: Mark whether the config file is already bootstrapped or not (Internal use. Don't set)

cloudtik_wheel_url.description: The CloudTik wheel URL from which to download and install when needed

disable_node_number.description: Whether disable the feature of assigning node number to each node

retry_setup_command.description: Whether to retry setup command if the command failed

retry_start_command.description: Whether to retry start command if the command failed

number_of_retries.description: The number of reties if the command failed

retry_interval.description: The time interval in seconds for command retry

module.description: module, if using external node provider

use_working_vpc.description: When use_internal_ips is true, whether to use the working client vpc.

peering_firewall_allow_working_subnet.description: Whether automatically allow working node subnet access to peering network in firewall rules.

peering_firewall_allow_ssh_only.description: Whether allow only the ssh access to peering network in the above firewall rules.

msi_identity_principal_id.description: User-defined managed identity principal id (generated by config)

head_service_account.description: k8s cluster head and controller permissions, if using k8s

head_role.description: k8s cluster head and controller permissions, if using k8s

head_role_binding.description: k8s cluster head and controller permissions, if using k8s

worker_service_account.description: k8s cluster worker permissions, if using k8s

cloud_provider.description: k8s cluster configurations for cloud provider integration.

cache_stopped_nodes.description: Whether to try to reuse previously stopped nodes instead of launching nodes. This will also cause the cluster scaler to stop nodes instead of terminating them. Only implemented for AWS.

prefer_spot_node.description: Whether to prefer to launch Spot instance to save money at the cost of uncertain termination.

disable_node_updaters.description: Disables node updaters if set to True. Default is False. (For Kubernetes operator usage.)

aws_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with the AWS using boto3. If not specified, will use environment default.

aws_access_key_id.description: The access key to use when creating the client.

aws_secret_access_key.description: The secret key to use when creating the client.

aws_session_token.description: The session token to use when creating the client.

gcp_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with the GCP client. If not specified, will use environment default.

type.description: Credentials type: either temporary OAuth 2.0 token or permanent service account credentials blob.

credentials.description: OAuth token fields or service account credentials fields

azure_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with the Azure Cloud. If not specified, will use environment default.

credentials.description: Credential fields based on different credential types.

client_id.description: The client id field for ClientSecret or ManagedIdentity credential.

tenant_id.description: The tenant id field for ClientSecret credential.

client_secret.description: The client secret field for ClientSecret credential.

aliyun_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with the Aliyun. If not specified, will use environment default.

aliyun_access_key_id.description: The access key to use when creating the client.

aliyun_access_key_secret.description: The secret key to use when creating the client.

aliyun_security_token.description: The optional session token to use when creating the client.

huaweicloud_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with HUAWEI CLOUD. If not specified, will use environment default.

huaweicloud_access_key.description: The access key to use when creating the client.

huaweicloud_secret_key.description: The secret key to use when creating the client.

gcs.service.account.private.key.id.description: gcp service account private key id

azure.storage.type.description: Azure cloud storage type: blob (Azure Blob Storage) or datalake (Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2).

oss.access.key.id.description: access key id of accessing OSS

oss.access.key.secret.description: access key secret of accessing OSS

obs.access.key.description: access key id of accessing OBS

username.description: Azure Database administrator login name. default: cloudtik

gcp.database.description: GCP Cloud SQL for MySQL options

port.description: GCP Cloud SQL server port. default: 3306

username.description: GCP Cloud SQL user name. default: root

verify_cloud_storage.description: Whether to verify the cloud storage configurations.

use_managed_cloud_storage.description: Whether to use managed cloud storage of workspace.

worker_role_for_cloud_storage.description: Whether to assign worker with the role to access cloud storage.

use_managed_cloud_database.description: Whether to use managed cloud database of workspace.

public_ip_bandwidth.description: Bandwidth of public ip in MB for node.

nodes.description: The list of nodes for local provider.

ip.description: The ip address of the node as node identifier.

instance_type.description: The optional instance type name defined in the instance types list.

instance_types.description: Instance type definitions specifying the resources of the type.

cloud_simulator_address.description: The cloud simulator address in the format of address:port for on-premise provider.

port_mapping_base.description: The port mapping shift to avoid port conflicts with host for virtual provider.

auth.description: How will authenticate with newly launched nodes.

ssh_port.default: Except that kubernetes is 9999, all others are 22

ssh_proxy_command.description: A value for ProxyCommand ssh option, for connecting through proxies. Example: nc -x proxy.example.com:1234 %h %p

docker.description: Docker configuration. If this is specified, all setup and start commands will be executed in the container.

enabled.description: Whether to run everything in docker container

image.description: the docker image name. If there is no tag specified, will use current CloudTik version as tag.

run_options.description: shared options for starting head/worker docker

head_image.description: image for head node, takes precedence over 'image' if specified

head_run_options.description: head specific run options, appended to run_options

disable_automatic_runtime_detection.description: disable automatically using the NVIDIA runtime if available

disable_head_automatic_runtime_detection.description: disable automatically using the NVIDIA runtime if available for head

disable_shm_size_detection.description: disable automatically detecting /dev/shm size for the container

initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands` on host for docker only

head_initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands` on host for docker only

worker_initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands` on host for docker only

head_node_type.description: If using multiple node types, specifies the head node type.

head_node.description: Provider-specific config for the head node, e.g. instance type.

file_mounts.description: Map of remote paths to local paths, e.g. {"/tmp/data": "/my/local/data"}

cluster_synced_files.description: List of paths on the head node which should sync to the worker nodes, e.g. ["/some/data/somehwere"]

file_mounts_sync_continuously.description: If enabled, file mounts will sync continously between the head node and the worker nodes. The nodes will not re-run setup commands if only the contents of the file mounts folders change.

rsync_exclude.description: File pattern to not sync up or down when using the rsync command. Matches the format of rsync's --exclude param.

rsync_filter.description: Pattern files to lookup patterns to exclude when using rsync up or rsync down. This file is checked for recursively in all directories. For example, if .gitignore is provided here, the behavior will match git's .gitignore behavior.

metadata.description: Metadata field that can be used to store user-defined data in the cluster config. We do not interpret these fields.

initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

head_initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

worker_initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

setup_commands.description: List of common commands to run to setup nodes.

head_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on the head node after common setup.

worker_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on worker nodes after common setup.

bootstrap_commands.description: Common setup commands running after all the setup commands.

head_start_commands.description: Command to start on the head node.

worker_start_commands.description: Command to start on worker nodes.

head_stop_commands.description: Command to stop on the head node.

worker_stop_commands.description: Command to stop on worker nodes.

no_restart.description: Whether to avoid restarting the cluster during updates. This field is controlled by the cloudtik --no-restart flag and cannot be set by the user.

merged_commands.description: The merged commands used internally. Don't override.

no_controller_on_head.description: Whether need to run controller on head. Internal flag, don't override.

available_node_types.description: A list of node types for multi-node-type autoscaling.

node_config.description: Provider-specific config for the node, e.g. instance type.

worker_initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

worker_setup_commands.description: List of common commands to run to setup on this specific node type.

bootstrap_commands.description: Common setup commands running after all the setup commands on this specific node type.

worker_start_commands.description: Command to start on this specific node type.

worker_stop_commands.description: Command to stop on this specific node type.

merged_commands.description: The merged commands used internally. Don't override.

runtime.description: Set the configurations for runtime components

types.description: The list of runtimes to enable for this cluster

worker_run_options.description: analogous to head_run_options, merged with the global docker run_options.

runtime.description: Set the configurations for runtime components

types.description: The list of runtimes to enable for this cluster

scaling_policy.description: The built-in scaling policy name to use. Values: scaling-with-load, scaling-with-time

scaling_step.description: The number of nodes for each scale up step.

scaling_resource.description: The resource type to check for scale: CPU or memory

cpu_load_threshold.description: The cpu load threshold to start scale

memory_load_threshold.description: The memory load threshold to start scale

in_use_cpu_load_threshold.description: The minimum cpu load to consider the machine is in use

scaling_periodic.description: The periodic to use for scaling with time policy. Values: daily, weekly, monthly

scaling_math_base.description: The base number to use for arithmetic such as *2. Values: on-min-workers, on-previous-time

scaling_policy_class.description: The module and class path of the scaling policy class

scaling_mode.description: The Spark scaling mode. Values: apps-pending, aggressive

scaling_step.description: The number of nodes for each scale up step.

scaling_resource.description: The resource type to check for scale: CPU or memory

apps_pending_threshold.description: The number of pending apps threshold to trigger scaling.

apps_pending_free_cores_threshold.description: The number of free cores threshold below which to trigger scaling.

apps_pending_free_memory_threshold.description: The size of free memory threshold in MB below which to trigger scaling.

aggressive_free_ratio_threshold.description: The free cpu or memory ratio below which to trigger scaling for aggressive mode.

hdfs_namenode_uri.description: HDFS service endpoint if Spark need to access HDFS.

hive_metastore_uri.description: Metastore service endpoint for Spark to use.

yarn_resource_memory_ratio.description: The yarn node virtual memory ratio vs the available physical memory.

yarn_scheduler.description: The yarn scheduler to use: capacity or fair

with_oneapi.description: Whether to use oneAPI frameworks and libraries for AI

with_intel_mpi.description: Whether to use Intel MPI. If with_oneapi is set, this is default true

with_oneccl.description: Whether to use oneCCL. If with_oneapi is set, this is default true

with_intel_pytorch.description: Whether to use Intel Optimizations of PyTorch. If with_oneapi is set, this is default true

with_gpu.description: Whether to use GPU frameworks and libraries for AI

auto_scaling.description: Whether to enable ray based auto scaling
